meanings.sent1: She was moiling in the garden all day, planting new flowers.
meanings.sent2: The workers were moiling under the hot sun to finish the construction on time.
meanings.sent3: After moiling for hours, she finally completed the challenging puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The students were moiling away at their desks, trying to finish the exam before time ran out.
meanings.sent5: The ants were moiling tirelessly to gather food for their colony.

meanings.sent1: He moiled the water in the bucket to mix the paint thoroughly.
meanings.sent2: The chef moiled the ingredients in the pot to create a delicious soup.
meanings.sent3: The kids moiled the sand at the beach, pretending to make a giant cake.
meanings.sent4: The storm moiled the sea, creating massive waves that crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent5: The blender moiled the fruits into a smooth and refreshing juice.

meanings.definition: Be in a state of turmoil or confusion
meanings.sent1: Her thoughts were moiling as she tried to make a difficult decision.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were moiling with people rushing to get to work.
meanings.sent3: The meeting room was moiling with heated discussions and conflicting opinions.
meanings.sent4: Emotions moiled within him as he struggled to control his anger.
meanings.sent5: The news of the unexpected event moiled the peaceful town into chaos.
